titles.title: SF529 Prayer is the soul's sincere desire

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Prayer is the soul's sincere desire,
Uttered or unexpressed!
The motion of a hidden fire,
That trembles in the breast.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
Prayer is the burden of a sigh,
The falling of a tear,
The upward glancing of an eye,
When none but God is near.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Prayer is the simplest form of speech
That infant lips can try;
Prayer, the sublimest strains that reach
The Majesty on high.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
Prayer is the contrite sinner's voice
returning from false ways
while angels in their songs rejoice,
and cry: The sinner prays!

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
Prayer is the Christian's vital breath,
the Christian's native air,
our watchword at the gates of death;
we enter heaven wiith prayer.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
O you by Whom we come to God,
The Life, the Truth, the Way!
The path of prayer yourself have trod,
Lord, teach us how to pray!
